Attribute.Name: sample_name
Attribute.Description: The sample name is a name that you choose for the sample, it works as an ID. Each sample name must be unique in a submission. Sample name cannot be changed after registration. After submitting BioSamples from D-way, BioSamples are sorted in alphabetical order of sample_name values
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: sample name は登録者がサンプルに付ける名前で ID として機能します。sample name は Submission においてユニークである必要があります。登録後は sample name を変更することはできません。1 submission 中で投稿された複数サンプルは sample_name のアルファベット順に並べ替えられますのでご注意ください。

Attribute.Name: sample_title
Attribute.Description: Sample title should be short and informative. Each sample title must be unique in a submission. Examples: 1) Escherichia coli O104:H4 str. C227-11 clinical isolate 2010_333_NC-6; 2) CD8+ T cells from female TSG6-knockout BALB/c mouse; 3) Human metagenome isolated from urine of healthy female.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: タイトルはサンプルをよく表す簡潔なものを記入します。 タイトルは Submission においてユニークである必要があります。 例: 1) Escherichia coli O104:H4 str. C227-11 clinical isolate 2010_333_NC-6; 2) CD8+ T cells from female TSG6-knockout BALB/c mouse; 3) Human metagenome isolated from urine of healthy female.

Attribute.Name: description
Attribute.Description: A brief description for the sample.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプルに対する簡潔な補足情報。

Attribute.Name: organism
Attribute.Description: The most descriptive organism name for this sample (to the species, if relevant) in the NCBI Taxonomy database. If it is not in the database, provide as much information about the organism as possible and the DDBJ staff apply a new organism name to NCBI Taxonomy.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: NCBI Taxonomy database に登録されている最も下位のランクの生物名 (適切な場合は species まで)。データベースに登録されていない場合，未登録の生物に関する情報をできるだけ記入してください。 DDBJ スタッフが NCBI Taxonomy に未登録の生物を申請します。

Attribute.Name: taxonomy_id
Attribute.Description: NCBI Taxonomy identifier. This is appropriate for individual organisms, some metagenomes and environmental samples. If it is not in the database, enter a tentative ID (e.g., 1). The DDBJ staff apply a new organism name to NCBI Taxonomy, and then the tentative ID is replaced by an assigned TaxID.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: NCBI Taxonomy identifier. 個別の生物、メタゲノム、環境サンプルに割り当てられています。データベースに登録されていない場合，仮の ID (例: 1)を記入してください。 DDBJ スタッフが NCBI Taxonomy に未登録の生物を申請後、割り当てられた TaxID に差し替えます。

Attribute.Name: bioproject_id
Attribute.Description: Associated BioProject accession number (PRJDB)
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 関連する BioProject アクセッション番号 (PRJDB)

Attribute.Name: locus_tag_prefix
Attribute.Description: "A locus tag prefix for an annotated genome/locus tag qualifier"
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: "アノテーションを記載するゲノムに対するユニークな locus_tag_prefix /locus tag について"

Attribute.Name: strain
Attribute.Description: Microbial/eukaryotic strain name
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 微生物や真核生物の株名。

Attribute.Name: breed
Attribute.Description: Breed name - chiefly used in domesticated animals or plants
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 品種の名称。主に家畜化された動物に用いられます。

Attribute.Name: cultivar
Attribute.Description: Cultivar name - cultivated variety of plant
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 植物の栽培品種名。

Attribute.Name: isolate
Attribute.Description: Identification or description of the specific individual from which this sample was obtained
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプルの得られた individual isolate

Attribute.Name: label
Attribute.Description: A label for sample, or name of an individual animal (e.g., Clint)
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 単離されたサンプルのラベル名，もしくは個々の動物の名前 (例: Clint)。

Attribute.Name: biomaterial_provider
Attribute.Description: name and address of the lab or PI, or a culture collection identifier
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 実験材料の提供元(例: culture collection identifier，Principal Investigator，研究室名)

Attribute.Name: env_biome
Attribute.Description: Descriptor of the broad ecological context of a sample. Examples include: desert, taiga or deciduous woodland. FAQ: What is the difference between biome, feature and material? EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプルに関する広い生態学的な環境。例: desert, taiga, deciduous woodland。FAQ: biome，feature，material の違いは？。EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: env_feature
Attribute.Description: Descriptor of the local environment. Examples include: harbor, cliff, or lake. FAQ: What is the difference between biome, feature and material? EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 局所的な環境。例：harbor, cliff, lake。FAQ: biome，feature，material の違いは？。EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: env_material
Attribute.Description: Material that was displaced by the sample, or material in which a sample was embedded, prior to the sampling event. Examples include: air, soil, or water. FAQ: What is the difference between biome, feature and material? EnvO (v 2013-06-14) terms can be found via the link: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプリングする前、サンプルによって置換されていた物質やサンプルが埋め込まれていた物質。例: air, soil, water。FAQ: biome，feature，material の違いは？。EnvO (v 2013-06-14) 用語は次のリストから探すことができます: www.environmentontology.org/Browse-EnvO

Attribute.Name: geo_loc_name
Attribute.Description: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from this list. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Japan:Kanagawa, Hakone, Lake Ashi"
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプルを得た地域。このリストから国, 大洋, または, 海, の名称を選択します。 コロンに続けて地方・地域を示します。 例：Japan:Kanagawa, Hakone, Lake Ashi

Attribute.Name: lat_lon
Attribute.Description: The geographical coordinates of the location where the sample was collected. Specify as decimal degrees latitude and longitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E", eg, “47.94 N 28.12 W” “45.0123 S 4.1234 E”
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプルが採取された位置の地理的座標。 (書式：d[d.dddd] d[dd.dddd] ) (例： "47.94 N 28.12 W", "45.0123 S 4.1234 E") 小数点以下の数字は分秒ではなく小数で記載してください。

Attribute.Name: project_name
Attribute.Description: A concise name that describes the overall project, for example "Analysis of sequences collected from Antarctic soil"
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 全体のプロジェクトを記載した簡潔な名称。(例： Analysis of sequences collected from Antarctic soil)

Attribute.Name: isol_growth_condt
Attribute.Description: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID, DOI or URL for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 単離や生育条件の詳細を記載している pubmed ID, DOI, あるいは URL

Attribute.Name: ref_biomaterial
Attribute.Description: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report in the form of pubmed ID, DOI or URL
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: Primary publication か primary genome report の pubmed ID, DOI, URL

Attribute.Name: num_replicons
Attribute.Description: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 真核生物の核ゲノム、微生物のゲノムにおけるレプリコンの数、セグメント化されたウィルスにおけるセグメントの数。

Attribute.Name: estimated_size
Attribute.Description: Estimated size of genome
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: ゲノムの推定のサイズ

Attribute.Name: ploidy
Attribute.Description: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid).
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: ゲノムの倍数性レベル (例: allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid)

Attribute.Name: propagation
Attribute.Description: This field is specific to different taxa. For phage: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic; for plasmid: incompatibility group; for eukaryote: asexual/sexual
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 増殖・繁殖方法。Phage: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic から選択します。Plasmid: 不和合性グループを記載します。真核生物: asexual/sexual のどちらか選択します。

Attribute.Name: biotic_relationship
Attribute.Description: Free-living or from host (define relationship)

Attribute.Name: encoded_traits
Attribute.Description: Traits like antibiotic resistance/xenobiotic degration phenotypes/converting phage genes

Attribute.Name: extrachrom_elements
Attribute.Description: Plasmids that have significance phenotypic consequence

Attribute.Name: health_disease_stat
Attribute.Description: Health or disease status of specific host at time of collection
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 収集時の宿主の健康状態
Attribute.Synonym: health or disease status of specific host at time of collection

Attribute.Name: host
Attribute.Description: The natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which the sample was obtained. Use the full taxonomic name, eg, "Homo sapiens".
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 生物の(実験室ではない)自然界における宿主の学名 (例: Homo sapiens)

Attribute.Name: host_spec_range
Attribute.Description: Taxid of the specific host if known
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 宿主の NCBI taxonomy ID

Attribute.Name: pathogenicity
Attribute.Description: To what is the entity pathogenic

Attribute.Name: rel_to_oxygen
Attribute.Description: Aerobic or anaerobic

Attribute.Name: samp_collect_device
Attribute.Description: Method or device employed for collecting sample

Attribute.Name: samp_mat_process
Attribute.Description: Processing applied to the sample during or after isolation

Attribute.Name: sample_size
Attribute.Description: Amount or size of sample
Attribute.Synonym: samp_size, sample size, amount or size of sample collected

Attribute.Name: source_material_id
Attribute.Description: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples.

Attribute.Name: subspecf_gen_lin
Attribute.Description: Information about the genetic distinctness of the lineage (eg., biovar, serovar)

Attribute.Name: trophic_level
Attribute.Description: Feeding position in food chain (eg., chemolithotroph)
Attribute.Format: ['', 'autotroph', ' carboxydotroph', ' chemoautotroph', ' chemoheterotroph', ' chemolithoautotroph', ' chemolithotroph', ' chemoorganoheterotroph', ' chemoorganotroph', ' chemosynthetic', ' chemotroph', ' copiotroph', ' diazotroph', ' facultative', ' autotroph', ' heterotroph', ' lithoautotroph', ' lithoheterotroph', ' lithotroph', ' methanotroph', ' methylotroph', ' mixotroph', ' obligate', ' chemoautolithotroph', ' oligotroph', ' organoheterotroph', ' organotroph', ' photoautotroph', ' photoheterotroph', ' photolithoautotroph', ' photolithotroph', ' photosynthetic', ' phototroph']

Attribute.Name: depth
Attribute.Description: Depth is defined as the vertical distance below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 水深・深度。局所表面下の垂直距離。例えば、堆積物や土壌サンプルの深度は堆積物や土壌の表面から測定される。深度は地下サンプルに対する距離として報告される。

Attribute.Name: elev
Attribute.Description: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプルを採取した場所の標高。平均海面からの垂直距離。

Attribute.Name: altitude
Attribute.Description: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 海抜上の地表面から空中にあるサンプルを採取した位置までの垂直距離。

Attribute.Name: tissue_type
Attribute.Description: Type of tissue the sample was taken from.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプルが得られた組織の名称

Attribute.Name: age
Attribute.Description: age at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプリング時の年齢。規模は種や研究に依存する。(例：アメーバに対する秒、樹木に対する世紀)

Attribute.Name: agrochem_addition
Attribute.Description: addition of fertilizers, pesticides, etc. - amount and time of applications

Attribute.Name: air_temp_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include different temperature regimens

Attribute.Name: al_sat
Attribute.Description: aluminum saturation (esp. for tropical soils)

Attribute.Name: al_sat_meth
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining Al saturation

Attribute.Name: alkalinity
Attribute.Description: alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

Attribute.Name: alkyl_diethers
Attribute.Description: concentration of alkyl diethers

Attribute.Name: aminopept_act
Attribute.Description: measurement of aminopeptidase activity

Attribute.Name: ammonium
Attribute.Description: concentration of ammonium

Attribute.Name: amniotic_fluid_color
Attribute.Description: specification of the color of the amniotic fluid sample

Attribute.Name: anamorph
Attribute.Description: Genus and species of the asexually reproducing stage of fungi - note that anamorph and teleomorph forms of the same taxon may have used taxonomic different names.

Attribute.Name: annual_season_precpt
Attribute.Description: mean annual and seasonal precipitation (mm)

Attribute.Name: annual_season_temp
Attribute.Description: mean annual and seasonal temperature (oC)

Attribute.Name: antibiotic_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple antibiotic regimens

Attribute.Name: atmospheric_data
Attribute.Description: measurement of atmospheric data; can include multiple data

Attribute.Name: authority
Attribute.Description: Authority for the species identification.

Attribute.Name: bacteria_carb_prod
Attribute.Description: measurement of bacterial carbon production

Attribute.Name: barometric_press
Attribute.Description: force per unit area exerted against a surface by the weight of air above that surface

Attribute.Name: biochem_oxygen_dem
Attribute.Description: a measure of the relative oxygen-depletion effect of a waste contaminant

Attribute.Name: biomass
Attribute.Description: amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. microbial, total. can include multiple measurements

Attribute.Name: birth_control
Attribute.Description: specification of birth control medication used

Attribute.Name: bishomohopanol
Attribute.Description: concentration of bishomohopanol

Attribute.Name: blood_blood_disord
Attribute.Description: history of blood disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: blood_press_diast
Attribute.Description: resting diastolic blood pressure, measured as mm mercury

Attribute.Name: blood_press_syst
Attribute.Description: resting systolic blood pressure, measured as mm mercury

Attribute.Name: body_habitat
Attribute.Description: original body habitat where the sample was obtained from

Attribute.Name: body_mass_index
Attribute.Description: body mass index, calculated as weight/(height)squared

Attribute.Name: body_product
Attribute.Description: substance produced by the plant where the sample was obtained from

Attribute.Name: bromide
Attribute.Description: concentration of bromide

Attribute.Name: calcium
Attribute.Description: concentration of calcium

Attribute.Name: carb_dioxide
Attribute.Description: carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: carb_monoxide
Attribute.Description: carbon monoxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: carb_nitro_ratio
Attribute.Description: ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen

Attribute.Name: cell_line
Attribute.Description: Name of the cell line.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: cell line の名称

Attribute.Name: cell_type
Attribute.Description: Type of cell of the sample or from which the sample was obtained.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプルの細胞のタイプ

Attribute.Name: chem_administration
Attribute.Description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see this list.

Attribute.Name: chem_mutagen
Attribute.Description: treatment involving use of mutagens; should include the name of mutagen, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mutagen regimens

Attribute.Name: chem_oxygen_dem
Attribute.Description: a measure of the relative oxygen-depletion effect of a waste contaminant

Attribute.Name: chloride
Attribute.Description: concentration of chloride

Attribute.Name: chlorophyll
Attribute.Description: concentration of chlorophyll

Attribute.Name: climate_environment
Attribute.Description: treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; can include multiple climates

Attribute.Name: collected_by
Attribute.Description: Name of persons or institute who collected the sample
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 標本個体を採集した人物、または、団体の名称

Attribute.Name: crop_rotation
Attribute.Description: whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule

Attribute.Name: culture_collection
Attribute.Description: Name of source institute and unique culture identifier. See the description for the proper format and list of allowed institutes.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: "配列の得られた培養細胞の保管施設と ID (例: ATCC:26370) 生きている微生物やウイルスの培養系, および細胞株を記載するのに用います。書式は institute のリストを参照してください。"

Attribute.Name: cur_land_use
Attribute.Description: present state of sample site
Attribute.Format: ['', 'cities', 'farmstead', 'industrial areas', 'roads/railroads', 'rock', 'sand', 'gravel', 'mudflats', 'salt flats', 'badlands', 'permanent snow or ice', 'saline seeps', 'mines/quarries', 'oil waste areas', 'small grains', 'row crops', 'vegetable crops', 'horticultural plants (e.g. tulips)', 'marshlands (grass,sedges,rushes)', 'tundra (mosses,lichens)', 'rangeland', 'pastureland (grasslands used for livestock grazing)', 'hayland', 'meadows (grasses,alfalfa,fescue,bromegrass,timothy)', 'shrub land (e.g. mesquite,sage-brush,creosote bush,shrub oak,eucalyptus)', 'successional shrub land (tree saplings,hazels,sumacs,chokecherry,shrub dogwoods,blackberries)', 'shrub crops (blueberries,nursery ornamentals,filberts)', 'vine crops (grapes)', 'conifers (e.g. pine,spruce,fir,cypress)', 'hardwoods (e.g. oak,hickory,elm,aspen)', 'intermixed hardwood and conifers', 'tropical (e.g. mangrove,palms)', 'rainforest (evergreen forest receiving >406 cm annual rainfall)', 'swamp (permanent or semi-permanent water body dominated by woody plants)', 'crop trees (nuts,fruit,christmas trees,nursery trees)']

Attribute.Name: cur_vegetation
Attribute.Description: vegetation classification from one or more standard classification systems, or agricultural crop

Attribute.Name: cur_vegetation_meth
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in vegetation classification

Attribute.Name: current
Attribute.Description: measurement of current

Attribute.Name: density
Attribute.Description: density of sample

Attribute.Name: dermatology_disord
Attribute.Description: history of dermatology disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: dev_stage
Attribute.Description: Developmental stage at the time of sampling.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプリング時における生物の発生段階

Attribute.Name: diet_last_six_month
Attribute.Description: specification of major diet changes in the last six months, if yes the change should be specified
Attribute.Synonym: major diet change in last six months

Attribute.Name: diether_lipids
Attribute.Description: concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids

Attribute.Name: disease
Attribute.Description: Name of relevant disease.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 関連する病気の名称

Attribute.Name: disease_stage
Attribute.Description: Stage of disease at the time of sampling.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプリング時における病気の段階

Attribute.Name: diss_carb_dioxide
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide

Attribute.Name: diss_hydrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved hydrogen

Attribute.Name: diss_inorg_carb
Attribute.Description: dissolved inorganic carbon concentration

Attribute.Name: diss_inorg_nitro
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved inorganic nitrogen

Attribute.Name: diss_inorg_phosp
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved inorganic phosphorus

Attribute.Name: diss_org_carb
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved organic carbon

Attribute.Name: diss_org_nitro
Attribute.Description: dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2

Attribute.Name: diss_oxygen
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved oxygen

Attribute.Name: dominant_hand
Attribute.Description: dominant hand of the subject

Attribute.Name: douche
Attribute.Description: date of most recent douche

Attribute.Name: drainage_class
Attribute.Description: drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

Attribute.Name: drug_usage
Attribute.Description: any drug used by subject and the frequency of usage; can include multiple drugs used

Attribute.Name: dry_mass
Attribute.Description: measurement of dry mass

Attribute.Name: efficiency_percent
Attribute.Description: percentage of volatile solids removed from the anaerobic digestor

Attribute.Name: emulsions
Attribute.Description: amount or concentration of substances such as paints, adhesives, mayonnaise, hair colorants, emulsified oils, etc.; can include multiple emulsion types

Attribute.Name: extreme_event
Attribute.Description: unusual physical events that may have affected microbial populations

Attribute.Name: extreme_salinity
Attribute.Description: measured salinity

Attribute.Name: family_relationship
Attribute.Description: relationships to other hosts in the same study; can include multiple relationships

Attribute.Name: fao_class
Attribute.Description: soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources

Attribute.Name: fertilizer_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving the use of fertilizers; should include the name fertilizer, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fertilizer regimens

Attribute.Name: fire
Attribute.Description: historical and/or physical evidence of fire

Attribute.Name: flooding
Attribute.Description: historical and/or physical evidence of flooding

Attribute.Name: foetal_health_stat
Attribute.Description: specification of foetal health status, should also include abortion

Attribute.Name: fungicide_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fungicide regimens

Attribute.Name: gaseous_environment
Attribute.Description: use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens

Attribute.Name: gaseous_substances
Attribute.Description: amount or concentration of substances such as hydrogen sulfide, carbon dioxide, methane, etc.; can include multiple substances

Attribute.Name: gastrointest_disord
Attribute.Description: history of gastrointestinal tract disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: genotype
Attribute.Description: observed genotype

Attribute.Name: gestation_state
Attribute.Description: specification of the gestation state

Attribute.Name: glucosidase_act
Attribute.Description: measurement of glucosidase activity

Attribute.Name: gravidity
Attribute.Description: whether or not subject is gravid, and if yes date due or date post-conception, specifying which is used

Attribute.Name: gravity
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity; can include multiple treatments

Attribute.Name: growth_hormone_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple growth hormone regimens

Attribute.Name: growth_med
Attribute.Description: information about growth media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples

Attribute.Name: gynecologic_disord
Attribute.Description: history of gynecological disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: haplotype
Attribute.Description: Name of the haplotype. Primarily used for identification. A combination of alleles at multiple loci on the same chromosome that are closely linked and tend to be inherited as a unit.

Attribute.Name: health_state
Attribute.Description: Health or disease status of sample at time of collection
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 収集時におけるサンプルの健康あるいは病気の状態

Attribute.Name: heavy_metals
Attribute.Description: heavy metals present and concentrations of any drug used by subject and the frequency of usage; can include multiple heavy metals and concentrations

Attribute.Name: heavy_metals_meth
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining heavy metals

Attribute.Name: height_or_length
Attribute.Description: measurement of height or length

Attribute.Name: herbicide_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: hiv_stat
Attribute.Description: HIV status of subject, if yes HAART initiation status should also be indicated as [YES or NO]

Attribute.Name: horizon
Attribute.Description: specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath
Attribute.Format: ['', 'O horizon', 'A horizon', 'E horizon', 'B horizon', 'C horizon', 'R layer', 'Permafrost']

Attribute.Name: horizon_meth
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining the horizon

Attribute.Name: host_age
Attribute.Description: Age of host at the time of sampling
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプリング時の宿主の年齢

Attribute.Name: host_body_site
Attribute.Description: name of body site where the sample was obtained from. For Foundational Model of Anatomy Ontology (FMA) (v3.1) terms, please see this site.

Attribute.Name: host_body_temp
Attribute.Description: core body temperature of the host when sample was collected
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプルを採取した時の宿主の体温

Attribute.Name: host_color
Attribute.Description: the color of host
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 宿主の色

Attribute.Name: host_common_name
Attribute.Description: common name of the host, e.g. human

Attribute.Name: host_description
Attribute.Description: Additional information not included in other defined vocabulary fields

Attribute.Name: host_diet
Attribute.Description: type of diet depending on the sample for animals omnivore, herbivore etc., for humans high-fat, meditteranean etc.; can include multiple diet types

Attribute.Name: host_disease
Attribute.Description: Name of relevant disease, e.g. Salmonella gastroenteritis. For the controlled vocabulary, please see Human Disease Ontology or MeSH.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 宿主の病気の名称。(例：Salmonella gastroenteritis) Controlled vocabulary として Human Disease Ontology，MeSH を参照してください。

Attribute.Name: host_disease_outcome
Attribute.Description: Final outcome of disease, e.g., death, chronic disease, recovery
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 病気の最終的な結果。(例：death, chronic disease, recovery)

Attribute.Name: host_disease_stage
Attribute.Description: Stage of disease at the time of sampling
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプリング時の宿主の病気の段階

Attribute.Name: host_disease_stat
Attribute.Description: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. the value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology), other hosts are free text
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: "宿主が診断されている疾患のリスト。複数の診断結果を含めることができます。宿主がヒトの場合は Disease Ontology から選択してください。他の宿主は自由記述です。"

Attribute.Name: host_growth_cond
Attribute.Description: literature reference giving growth conditions of the host

Attribute.Name: host_health_state
Attribute.Description: Information regarding health state of the individual sampled at the time of sampling
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプリング時の個々のサンプルの健康状態に関する情報

Attribute.Name: host_height
Attribute.Description: the height of subject

Attribute.Name: host_sex
Attribute.Description: Gender or physical sex of the host
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 宿主の性別

Attribute.Name: host_shape
Attribute.Description: morphological shape of host
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 宿主の形態学的形状

Attribute.Name: host_subject_id
Attribute.Description: a unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 宿主の匿名化されたユニーク ID

Attribute.Name: host_taxid
Attribute.Description: NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 宿主の NCBI Taxonomy identifier

Attribute.Name: host_tissue_sampled
Attribute.Description: Type of tissue the initial sample was taken from. Controlled vocabulary, http://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/1005.

Attribute.Name: hrt
Attribute.Description: whether subject had hormone replacement theraphy, and if yes start date

Attribute.Name: humidity
Attribute.Description: amount of water vapour in the air, at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: humidity_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include amount of humidity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: hysterectomy
Attribute.Description: specification of whether hysterectomy was performed

Attribute.Name: ihmc_ethnicity
Attribute.Description: ethnicity of the subject

Attribute.Name: ihmc_medication_code
Attribute.Description: can include multiple medication codes

Attribute.Name: indust_eff_percent
Attribute.Description: percentage of industrial effluents received by wastewater treatment plant

Attribute.Name: infra_specific_name
Attribute.Description: taxonomic information about the host below subspecies level

Attribute.Name: infra_specific_rank
Attribute.Description: taxonomic rank information about the host below subspecies level, such as variety, form, rank etc.

Attribute.Name: inorg_particles
Attribute.Description: concentration of particles such as sand, grit, metal particles, ceramics, etc.; can include multiple particles

Attribute.Name: isolation_source
Attribute.Description: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプルが得られた生物学的サンプルに関する, 物理的, 環境的, かつまたは, 地理的な由来

Attribute.Name: kidney_disord
Attribute.Description: history of kidney disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: lab_host
Attribute.Description: Originally meaning host on which a parasite is maintained in the lab, which may not be the same as the natural host (example hamster cells used to support a parasite normally found in mouse in the wild).
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 配列決定した分子を得た生物を増殖させるために実験室で使われた宿主の学名

Attribute.Name: last_meal
Attribute.Description: content of last meal and time since feeding; can include multiple values

Attribute.Name: life_stage
Attribute.Description: description of life stage of host

Attribute.Name: light_intensity
Attribute.Description: measurement of light intensity

Attribute.Name: link_class_info
Attribute.Description: link to digitized soil maps or other soil classification information

Attribute.Name: link_climate_info
Attribute.Description: link to climate resource

Attribute.Name: liver_disord
Attribute.Description: history of liver disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: local_class
Attribute.Description: soil classification based on local soil classification system

Attribute.Name: local_class_meth
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining the local soil classification

Attribute.Name: magnesium
Attribute.Description: concentration of magnesium

Attribute.Name: maternal_health_stat
Attribute.Description: specification of the maternal health status

Attribute.Name: mean_frict_vel
Attribute.Description: measurement of mean friction velocity

Attribute.Name: mean_peak_frict_vel
Attribute.Description: measurement of mean peak friction velocity

Attribute.Name: mechanical_damage
Attribute.Description: information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites

Attribute.Name: medic_hist_perform
Attribute.Description: whether full medical history was collected

Attribute.Name: menarche
Attribute.Description: date of most recent menstruation

Attribute.Name: menopause
Attribute.Description: date of onset of menopause

Attribute.Name: methane
Attribute.Description: methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: microbial_biomass
Attribute.Description: the part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometers. IF you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units, which should be mg C (or N)/kg soil).

Attribute.Name: microbial_biomass_meth
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining microbial biomass

Attribute.Name: mineral_nutr_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens

Attribute.Name: misc_param
Attribute.Description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

Attribute.Name: n_alkanes
Attribute.Description: concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes

Attribute.Name: nitrate
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrate

Attribute.Name: nitrite
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrite

Attribute.Name: nitro
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrogen (total)

Attribute.Name: non_mineral_nutr_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens

Attribute.Name: nose_mouth_teeth_throat_disord
Attribute.Description: history of nose/mouth/teeth/throat disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: nose_throat_disord
Attribute.Description: history of nose-throat disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: occupation
Attribute.Description: most frequent job performed by subject

Attribute.Name: org_carb
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic carbon

Attribute.Name: org_matter
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic matter

Attribute.Name: org_nitro
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic nitrogen

Attribute.Name: org_particles
Attribute.Description: concentration of particles such as faeces, hairs, food, vomit, paper fibers, plant material, humus, etc.

Attribute.Name: organism_count
Attribute.Description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample, should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

Attribute.Name: oxy_stat_samp
Attribute.Description: oxygenation status of sample

Attribute.Name: oxygen
Attribute.Description: oxygen (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: part_org_carb
Attribute.Description: concentration of particulate organic carbon

Attribute.Name: part_org_nitro
Attribute.Description: concentration of particulate organic nitrogen

Attribute.Name: particle_class
Attribute.Description: particles are classified, based on their size, into six general categories: clay, silt, sand, gravel, cobbles, and boulders; should include amount of particle preceded by the name of the particle type; can include multiple values

Attribute.Name: passage_history
Attribute.Description: Number of passages and passage method

Attribute.Name: pathotype
Attribute.Description: Some bacterial specific pathotypes (example Eschericia coli - STEC, UPEC)

Attribute.Name: pathovar
Attribute.Description: Taxonomy below subspecies; a variety (in bacteria, fungi or virus) usually based on its pathogenic properties. Sometimes used as equivalent to subspecies.

Attribute.Name: perturbation
Attribute.Description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

Attribute.Name: pesticide_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple pesticide regimens

Attribute.Name: pet_farm_animal
Attribute.Description: specification of presence of pets or farm animals in the environment of subject, if yes the animals should be specified; can include multiple animals present
Attribute.Synonym: presence of pets or farm animals

Attribute.Name: petroleum_hydrocarb
Attribute.Description: concentration of petroleum hydrocarbon

Attribute.Name: ph
Attribute.Description: pH measurement

Attribute.Name: ph_meth
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining pH

Attribute.Name: ph_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of pH of the growth media; can include multiple regimen

Attribute.Name: phaeopigments
Attribute.Description: concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments

Attribute.Name: phenotype
Attribute.Description: Phenotype of sampled organism. For Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v1.269) terms, please see this link.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプル生物の表現型。Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v1.269) の用語はこのリンクを参照してください。

Attribute.Name: phosphate
Attribute.Description: concentration of phosphate

Attribute.Name: phosplipid_fatt_acid
Attribute.Description: concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values

Attribute.Name: photon_flux
Attribute.Description: measurement of photon flux

Attribute.Name: plant_body_site
Attribute.Description: name of body site that the sample was obtained from. For PO (v819) terms please see this site.

Attribute.Name: plant_product
Attribute.Description: substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from

Attribute.Name: pollutants
Attribute.Description: pollutant types and, amount or concentrations measured at the time of sampling; can report multiple pollutants by entering numeric values preceded by name of pollutant

Attribute.Name: pool_dna_extracts
Attribute.Description: were multiple DNA extractions mixed? how many?

Attribute.Name: porosity
Attribute.Description: porosity of deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample

Attribute.Name: potassium
Attribute.Description: concentration of potassium

Attribute.Name: pre_treatment
Attribute.Description: the process of pre-treatment removes materials that can be easily collected from the raw wastewater

Attribute.Name: pregnancy
Attribute.Description: date due of pregnancy

Attribute.Name: pressure
Attribute.Description: pressure to which the sample is subject, in atmospheres

Attribute.Name: previous_land_use
Attribute.Description: previous land use and dates

Attribute.Name: previous_land_use_meth
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining previous land use and dates

Attribute.Name: primary_prod
Attribute.Description: measurement of primary production

Attribute.Name: primary_treatment
Attribute.Description: the process to produce both a generally homogeneous liquid capable of being treated biologically and a sludge that can be separately treated or processed

Attribute.Name: profile_position
Attribute.Description: cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected, sample area position in relation to surrounding areas

Attribute.Name: pulmonary_disord
Attribute.Description: history of pulmonary disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: pulse
Attribute.Description: resting pulse, measured as beats per minute

Attribute.Name: radiation_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving exposure of plant or a plant part to a particular radiation regimen; should include the radiation type, amount or intensity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple radiation regimens

Attribute.Name: rainfall_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: reactor_type
Attribute.Description: anaerobic digesters can be designed and engineered to operate using a number of different process configurations, as batch or continuous, mesophilic, high solid or low solid, and single stage or multistage

Attribute.Name: redox_potential
Attribute.Description: redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential

Attribute.Name: resp_part_matter
Attribute.Description: concentration of substances that remain suspended in the air, and comprise mixtures of organic and inorganic substances (PM10 and PM2.5); can report multiple PM's by entering numeric values preceded by name of PM

Attribute.Name: salinity
Attribute.Description: salinity measurement

Attribute.Name: salinity_meth
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining salinity

Attribute.Name: salt_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple salt regimens

Attribute.Name: samp_salinity
Attribute.Description: salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration

Attribute.Name: samp_store_dur
Attribute.Description: duration for which sample was stored

Attribute.Name: samp_store_loc
Attribute.Description: location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room

Attribute.Name: samp_store_temp
Attribute.Description: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

Attribute.Name: samp_vol_we_dna_ext
Attribute.Description: weight (g) of soil processed

Attribute.Name: sample_type
Attribute.Description: Sample type, such as cell culture, mixed culture, tissue sample, whole organism, single cell, metagenomic assembly

Attribute.Name: season_environment
Attribute.Description: treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.)

Attribute.Name: secondary_treatment
Attribute.Description: the process for substantially degrading the biological content of the sewage

Attribute.Name: sediment_type
Attribute.Description: information about the sediment type based on major constituents

Attribute.Name: serotype
Attribute.Description: Taxonomy below subspecies; a variety (in bacteria, fungi or virus) usually based on its antigenic properties. Same as serovar and serogroup. e.g. serotype="H1N1" in Influenza A virus CY098518.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: subspecies 以下の分類。配列の得られた生物, ウイルスなどの血清学的タイプ。例: serotype="H1N1" (インフルエンザ A 型 の場合)

Attribute.Name: serovar
Attribute.Description: Taxonomy below subspecies; a variety (in bacteria, fungi or virus) usually based on its antigenic properties. Same as serovar and serotype. Sometimes used as species identifier in bacteria with shaky taxonomy, e.g. Leptospira interrogans serovar Hardjo
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: subspecies 以下の分類。(一般に原核生物で)抗原特性により分類される血清学的変種。例: serovar="O157:H7"

Attribute.Name: sewage_type
Attribute.Description: type of wastewater treatment plant as municipial or industrial

Attribute.Name: sex
Attribute.Description: physical sex of sampled organism
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: サンプル生物の性別

Attribute.Name: sexual_act
Attribute.Description: current sexual partner and frequency of sex

Attribute.Name: sieving
Attribute.Description: collection design of pooled samples and/or sieve size and amount of sample sieved

Attribute.Name: silicate
Attribute.Description: concentration of silicate

Attribute.Name: slope_aspect
Attribute.Description: the direction a slope faces. While looking down a slope use a compass to record the direction you are facing (direction or degrees); e.g., NW or 315°. This measure provides an indication of sun and wind exposure that will influence soil temperature and evapotranspiration.

Attribute.Name: slope_gradient
Attribute.Description: commonly called "slope". The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer.

Attribute.Name: sludge_retent_time
Attribute.Description: the time activated sludge remains in reactor

Attribute.Name: smoker
Attribute.Description: specification of smoking status

Attribute.Name: sodium
Attribute.Description: sodium concentration

Attribute.Name: soil_type
Attribute.Description: soil series name or other lower-level classification

Attribute.Name: soil_type_meth
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

Attribute.Name: solar_irradiance
Attribute.Description: the amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval

Attribute.Name: soluble_inorg_mat
Attribute.Description: concentration of substances such as ammonia, road-salt, sea-salt, cyanide, hydrogen sulfide, thiocyanates, thiosulfates, etc.

Attribute.Name: soluble_org_mat
Attribute.Description: concentration of substances such as urea, fruit sugars, soluble proteins, drugs, pharmaceuticals, etc.

Attribute.Name: soluble_react_phosp
Attribute.Description: concentration of soluble reactive phosphorus

Attribute.Name: special_diet
Attribute.Description: specification of special diet; can include multiple special diets

Attribute.Name: specimen_voucher
Attribute.Description: Identifier for the physical specimen. Use format: "[<institution-code>:[<collection-code>:]]<specimen_id>", eg, "UAM:Mamm:52179". Intended as a reference to the physical specimen that remains after it was analyzed. If the specimen was destroyed in the process of analysis, electronic images (e-vouchers) are an adequate substitute for a physical voucher specimen. Ideally the specimens will be deposited in a curated museum, herbarium, or frozen tissue collection, but often they will remain in a personal or laboratory collection for some time before they are deposited in a curated collection. There are three forms of specimen_voucher qualifiers. If the text of the qualifier includes one or more colons it is a 'structured voucher'. Structured vouchers include institution-codes (and optional collection-codes) taken from a controlled vocabulary maintained by the INSDC that denotes the museum or herbarium collection where the specimen resides, please visit the INSDC website.
Attribute.DescriptionJapanese: 配列の得られた標本(動植物個体の一部 または 全体)が維持管理されている管理団体とＩＤ。(書式：[<institution_code>:[<collection_code>:]]<specimen_id>)(例：UAM:Mamm:52179) <collection_code> が存在しない場合は記載不要です。<institution_code> はこちらを参照してください。

Attribute.Name: standing_water_regm
Attribute.Description: treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: store_cond
Attribute.Description: explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction.

Attribute.Name: study_complt_stat
Attribute.Description: specification of study completion status, if no the reason should be specified

Attribute.Name: subgroup
Attribute.Description: Taxonomy below subspecies; sometimes used in viruses to denote subgroups taken from a single isolate.

Attribute.Name: substrate
Attribute.Description: the growth substrate of the host

Attribute.Name: subtype
Attribute.Description: Used as classifier in viruses (e.g. HIV type 1, Group M, Subtype A).

Attribute.Name: sulfate
Attribute.Description: concentration of sulfate

Attribute.Name: sulfide
Attribute.Description: concentration of sulfide

Attribute.Name: suspend_part_matter
Attribute.Description: concentration of suspended particulate matter

Attribute.Name: suspend_solids
Attribute.Description: concentration of substances including a wide variety of material, such as silt, decaying plant and animal matter, etc,; can include multiple substances

Attribute.Name: teleomorph
Attribute.Description: Genus and species of the sexual (fruiting) form of fungi - note that anamorph and teleomorph forms of the same taxon may have used taxonomic different names.

Attribute.Name: temp
Attribute.Description: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: tertiary_treatment
Attribute.Description: the process providing a final treatment stage to raise the effluent quality before it is discharged to the receiving environment

Attribute.Name: texture
Attribute.Description: the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.

Attribute.Name: texture_meth
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining soil texture

Attribute.Name: tidal_stage
Attribute.Description: stage of tide

Attribute.Name: tillage
Attribute.Description: note method(s) used for tilling

Attribute.Name: time_last_toothbrush
Attribute.Description: specification of the time since last toothbrushing

Attribute.Name: time_since_last_wash
Attribute.Description: specification of the time since last wash

Attribute.Name: tiss_cult_growth_med
Attribute.Description: description of plant tissue culture growth media used

Attribute.Name: tot_carb
Attribute.Description: total carbon content

Attribute.Name: tot_depth_water_col
Attribute.Description: measurement of total depth of water column

Attribute.Name: tot_diss_nitro
Attribute.Description: total dissolved nitrogen concentration, reported as nitrogen, measured by: total dissolved nitrogen = NH4 + NO3NO2 + dissolved organic nitrogen

Attribute.Name: tot_inorg_nitro
Attribute.Description: total inorganic nitrogen content

Attribute.Name: tot_mass
Attribute.Description: total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

Attribute.Name: tot_n_meth
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining the total N

Attribute.Name: tot_nitro
Attribute.Description: total nitrogen concentration, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen

Attribute.Name: tot_org_c_meth
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining total organic C

Attribute.Name: tot_org_carb
Attribute.Description: Definition for soil: total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil. Definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

Attribute.Name: tot_part_carb
Attribute.Description: total particulate carbon content

Attribute.Name: tot_phosp
Attribute.Description: total phosphorus concentration, calculated by: total phosphorus = total dissolved phosphorus + particulate phosphorus. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as phosphorus

Attribute.Name: tot_phosphate
Attribute.Description: total amount or concentration of phosphate

Attribute.Name: travel_out_six_month
Attribute.Description: specification of the countries travelled in the last six months; can include multiple travels
Attribute.Synonym: travel outside the country in last six months

Attribute.Name: turbidity
Attribute.Description: turbidity measurement

Attribute.Name: twin_sibling
Attribute.Description: specification of twin sibling presence

Attribute.Name: urine_collect_meth
Attribute.Description: specification of urine collection method

Attribute.Name: urogenit_disord
Attribute.Description: history of urogenital disorders, can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: urogenit_tract_disor
Attribute.Description: history of urogenitaltract disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: ventilation_rate
Attribute.Description: ventilation rate of the system in the sampled premises

Attribute.Name: ventilation_type
Attribute.Description: ventilation system used in the sampled premises

Attribute.Name: volatile_org_comp
Attribute.Description: concentration of carbon-based chemicals that easily evaporate at room temperature; can report multiple volatile organic compounds by entering numeric values preceded by name of compound

Attribute.Name: wastewater_type
Attribute.Description: the origin of wastewater such as human waste, rainfall, storm drains, etc.

Attribute.Name: water_content
Attribute.Description: water content measurement

Attribute.Name: water_content_soil
Attribute.Description: water content (g/g or cm3/cm3)

Attribute.Name: water_content_soil_meth
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining the water content of soil

Attribute.Name: water_temp_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: watering_regm
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: weight_loss_3_month
Attribute.Description: specification of weight loss in the last three months, if yes should be further specified to include amount of weight loss
Attribute.Synonym: weight loss in last three months

Attribute.Name: wet_mass
Attribute.Description: measurement of wet mass

Attribute.Name: wind_direction
Attribute.Description: wind direction is the direction from which a wind originates

Attribute.Name: wind_speed
Attribute.Description: speed of wind measured at the time of sampling
